title: How to Track Business Expenses for Tax Deductions
description: Stop missing deductions. Set up simple expense tracking that could save you thousands.
requirements: Your recent receipts (if you have any)

steps.title: Choose an expense tracking method
substeps: Simplest: Wave (waveapps.com) — free, tracks expenses and income together
Photo-based: Expensify (free tier) — snap receipts, auto-extracts info
Spreadsheet: Google Sheets — free, total control, requires discipline
Already use QuickBooks: Use its built-in expense tracking
steps.tip: Wave is great if you already use it for invoicing — everything in one place.

steps.title: Connect your business bank account
steps.description: Let the app pull in expenses automatically.
substeps: In Wave: Go to Banking → Connect an account
Select your bank and log in
Transactions import automatically
Review and categorize new expenses weekly
steps.tip: Use a separate bank account and credit card for business. Makes tracking 10x easier.

steps.title: Learn the main expense categories
substeps: Equipment and tools
Vehicle expenses (mileage or actual costs)
Materials and supplies
Insurance, licenses, permits
Phone and internet (business portion)
Marketing and advertising
Professional services (accountant, lawyer)

steps.title: Set up receipt capture
steps.description: Receipts are proof. No receipt = no deduction if audited.
substeps: Download the Wave or Expensify app
When you buy something, snap a photo immediately
The app extracts the info and attaches it to the expense
Get in the habit: buy something, take a photo, move on
steps.tip: Email receipts count too. Forward them to your app's email import address.

steps.title: Review weekly
steps.description: 10 minutes a week prevents tax season panic.
substeps: Pick a day (Friday afternoon works well)
Log in and categorize any uncategorized expenses
Check for missing big purchases
Make sure everything looks right

successMessage: You're now tracking expenses! Your tax preparer (and your wallet) will thank you.
proTips: Most contractors miss $5,000-10,000 in deductions because of poor tracking
Track vehicle mileage — standard deduction is $0.67/mile for 2024. It adds up fast.
At year end, export your expenses and give them to your accountant. They'll love you.
